channel.title: 504/505 loader
channel.description: does any1 have a 505 or 504 loader, if so post please edit hd plz edit2 if you got from worldid.runescape.com/loader.jar then i dont want lol

item.title: 504/505 loader
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

light232:

keep backup of each cache lolz on the svn

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:14, topic:230097”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=302830.msg2431408#msg2431408 date=1220902715]
While it would probably be difficult and useless, archiving the cache would be interesting, then analyze it, checking the number of model files etc between versions.
[/quote]

Good idea, but I’m too busy to write a JAGGRAB client right now, if anyone wants to write a program to check for and download new versions of the cache feel free to send it to me and I will run it via a cronjob on my server to make the archive available to everyone. Any takers?[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: 504/505 loader
item.dc:creator: @light232 light232
item.description:
@light232 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:20, topic:230097”][quote author=BAsh link=topic=302830.msg2433644#msg2433644 date=1221056668]

[quote] // write the byte array to a jar file the way jagex unpacks it, I don’t exactly know why if you have the above
// statement dump directly to a file it is not in a valid zip format…[/quote]
Looks redundant to me. The only thing I can think of is that the format isn’t quite a jar. A format with a slight tweak that java will ignore but cause other decompressers will crash.
[/quote]

‘unzip’ says a dump of the original jar is not a valid zip format, but after the following code it creates a valid zip file. I agree with you it looks completely redundant, but for some reason thats the way it has to be done. I’d love someone to explain it to me [/quote]
keep backup of each cache lolz on the svn

Read full topic

Looks redundant to me. The only thing I can think of is that the format isn’t quite a jar. A format with a slight tweak that java will ignore but cause other decompressers will crash.[/quote]

‘unzip’ says a dump of the original jar is not a valid zip format, but after the following code it creates a valid zip file. I agree with you it looks completely redundant, but for some reason thats the way it has to be done. I’d love someone to explain it to me

Read full topic

@BAsh wrote:

// write the byte array to a jar file the way jagex unpacks it, I don't exactly know why if you have the above // statement dump directly to a file it is not in a valid zip format...
Looks redundant to me. The only thing I can think of is that the format isn't quite a jar. A format with a slight tweak that java will ignore but cause other decompressers will crash.

Read full topic

item.title: 504/505 loader
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:15, topic:230097”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=302830.msg2432116#msg2432116 date=1220932426]

While it would probably be difficult and useless, archiving the cache would be interesting, then analyze it, checking the number of model files etc between versions.

Good idea, but I’m too busy to write a JAGGRAB client right now, if anyone wants to write a program to check for and download new versions of the cache feel free to send it to me and I will run it via a cronjob on my server to make the archive available to everyone. Any takers?
[/quote]they havent used jaggrab for like 2 years[/quote]

I just decompiled the latest loader_gl.jar to see what it looks like and they still use JAGGRAB.

edit:
Proof:
Lines 230 to 236 from loader.java produced from ‘jad -sjava loader.class’ from http://moparisthebest.com/rs/bin_gl/ldr_gl09-08-08_01.jar

            URL url = getCodeBase();
            Socket socket = new Socket(InetAddress.getByName(url.getHost()), 443);
            socket.setSoTimeout(10000);
            OutputStream outputstream = socket.getOutputStream();
            outputstream.write(17);
            outputstream.write(("JAGGRAB " + url.getFile() + b1.a + "\n\n").getBytes());
            inputstream = socket.getInputStream();

So they are either tricking us into thinking they use JAGGRAB, or much more likely they actually do…

BAsh:

If you could dump the pack200 file as a jar that would be great. Makes things a lot easier.

I’m sure I can write something up to convert them.

edit:
This should do it.

[code]import java.io.*;
import java.util.jar.JarOutputStream;
import java.util.jar.Pack200;
import java.util.zip.GZIPInputStream;
import java.util.zip.ZipEntry;
import java.util.zip.ZipInputStream;
import java.util.zip.ZipOutputStream;

/**

  • This unpacks a jagex made .pack200 file, which they slightly change to give me a headache.

  • @author moparisthebest
    */
    public class RsPack200ToJar {

    public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
    if (args.length != 2) {
    System.out.println(“Usage: RsPack200ToJar inFile outFile”);
    return;
    }
    File inFile = new File(args[0]);
    FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(inFile);
    byte abyte0[] = new byte[(int) inFile.length()];
    fis.read(abyte0);
    //jagex strips the gzip header, so tack it back on at the beginning
    byte abyte1[] = new byte[abyte0.length + 2];
    abyte1[0] = 31;
    abyte1[1] = -117;
    System.arraycopy(abyte0, 0, abyte1, 2, abyte0.length);
    ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
    //unpack the .pack200 to a byte array
    Pack200.newUnpacker().unpack(new GZIPInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(abyte1)), new JarOutputStream(bos));
    // write the byte array to a jar file the way jagex unpacks it, I don’t exactly know why if you have the above
    // statement dump directly to a file it is not in a valid zip format…
    byte abyte2[] = new byte[1000];
    ZipInputStream zis = new ZipInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(bos.toByteArray()));
    ZipOutputStream zos = new ZipOutputStream(new FileOutputStream(args[1]));
    do {
    ZipEntry zipentry = zis.getNextEntry();
    if (zipentry == null)
    break;
    zos.putNextEntry(zipentry);
    do {
    int i = zis.read(abyte2, 0, 1000);
    if (~i == 0)
    break;
    zos.write(abyte2, 0, i);
    } while (true);
    } while (true);
    zis.close();
    zos.close();
    }
    }
    [/code]
    Anyone have a cleaner way to do it? I got most of this code from the latest loader_gl.jar

The jars will be located here: http://moparisthebest.com/rs/bin_gl/pack200tojar/

Read full topic

item.title: 504/505 loader
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:11, topic:230097”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=302830.msg2430927#msg2430927 date=1220851421]

If you want code to load one of those clients (and slightly more) checkout the latest SVN from http://sourceforge.net/svn/?group_id=182122 , otherwise the archive of the official loader is where quaters pointed out.

I made a mistake when saying that :P. He wants a hd loader, while your archive only has the normal loaders.

HD loaders are located at world53.runescape.com/loader_gl.jar
HD clients (only pack200) at world53.runescape.com/runescape_gl.pack200

So it did, well I went ahead and updated my script to archive those as well. Does anyone think I should archive any other files too?

http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs/
[/quote]Maybe classic cheating files? Like old bots, etc.

It would be cool to have like an achieved history.[/quote]

I’ve got all of those, many of which are at http://moparisthebest.com/downloads/

What I meant though is files that should be archived from the runescape servers (like how I archive all the jars and the .pack200 file now) when they change.

Read full topic

item.title: 504/505 loader
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“qauters, post:8, topic:230097”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=302830.msg2430208#msg2430208 date=1220819839]

If you want code to load one of those clients (and slightly more) checkout the latest SVN from http://sourceforge.net/svn/?group_id=182122 , otherwise the archive of the official loader is where quaters pointed out.

HD loaders are located at world53.runescape.com/loader_gl.jar

Actually if I recall correctly, the URL for the loader works like this (REGEX representation):

http://world(\d+).runescape.com/loader(\S+).jar
[/quote]
Not since we have HD loaders ^^, they are called loader_gl-(\S+).jar.
download them both and see the difference.
I use this, because the hd client/loader are different, so you need to hook them apart.[/quote]Ahh you’re right. I forgot the _gl- part, but other than that, I knew it.

Read full topic
